content:
TITLE: Cloning Suna Repository
DESCRIPTION: These commands clone the Suna repository from GitHub and navigate into the project directory.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kortix-ai/suna.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/kortix-ai/suna.git
cd suna
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: These commands install the necessary dependencies for both the frontend and backend of the Suna project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kortix-ai/suna.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Install frontend dependencies
cd frontend
npm install

# Install backend dependencies
cd ../backend
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Backend Environment
DESCRIPTION: These commands create and edit the backend environment file. The .env file contains various configuration settings including API keys and database credentials.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kortix-ai/suna.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd backend
cp .env.example .env  # Create from example if available, or use the following template
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting the Suna Application
DESCRIPTION: These commands start the frontend and backend services of the Suna application in separate terminals.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kortix-ai/suna.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# In one terminal, start the frontend:
cd frontend
npm run dev

# In another terminal, start the backend:
cd backend
python api.py
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Frontend Environment
DESCRIPTION: These commands create and edit the frontend environment file. The .env.local file contains configuration settings for the frontend application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kortix-ai/suna.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd ../frontend
cp .env.example .env.local  # Create from example if available, or use the following template
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Supabase Database
DESCRIPTION: These commands use the Supabase CLI to log in, link to the project, and push database migrations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kortix-ai/suna.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
# Login to Supabase CLI
supabase login

# Link to your project (find your project reference in the Supabase dashboard)
supabase link --project-ref your_project_reference_id

# Push database migrations
supabase db push
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting a Next.js Development Server with Package Managers
DESCRIPTION: Commands to start the Next.js development server using different package managers including npm, yarn, pnpm, and bun. After running any of these commands, the application will be available at http://localhost:3000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kortix-ai/suna.git/blob/main/frontend/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
# or
yarn dev
# or
pnpm dev
# or
bun dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Python Package Dependencies with Version Specifications
DESCRIPTION: Lists required Python packages with pinned version numbers. Includes FastAPI for web API, Uvicorn for ASGI server, PyAutoGUI for GUI automation, Pillow for image processing, Pydantic for data validation, and PyTesseract for OCR functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kortix-ai/suna.git/blob/main/backend/sandbox/docker/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plain
CODE:
```
fastapi==0.115.12
uvicorn==0.34.0
pyautogui==0.9.54
pillow==10.2.0
pydantic==2.6.1
pytesseract==0.3.13
```
